claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.
explanation: A multi-panel figure showing geometric mean fold rise in antibody titers at 1 month post-vaccination and fold reduction at 6 months post-vaccination for two age groups (18–44 and 45–64 years) across multiple influenza strains (H3N2 egg, H3N2 cell, H1N1 egg, H1N1 cell, B/Victoria egg, B/Victoria cell, B/Yamagata egg, B/Yamagata cell), comparing four vaccines (Fluzone IIV4, Fluarix IIV4, ccIIV4, RIV4). The figure provides immunogenicity data (antibody titer fold rises and declines) but contains no information on antigenic composition or matching to WHO- or FDA-selected strains, and therefore does not support the claim. Note: The figure is clear and readable, but it does not address antigenic matching, only immune response metrics.
